meanings.definition: Make a witty or sarcastic remark.
meanings.sent1: She wisecracked about the weather, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: He always wisecracked during class, keeping things light.
meanings.sent3: The comedian wisecracked about his own bad dancing skills.
meanings.sent4: Her words wisecracked through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The old man wisecracked with a twinkle in his eye.

meanings.sent1: His wisecrack made the whole room burst into laughter.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but giggle at his clever wisecrack.
meanings.sent3: The movie character's wisecrack added humor to the scene.
meanings.sent4: The wisecrack cut through the seriousness of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's wisecrack was the highlight of the show.
